remarks: A permutation of a finite set fixing one element is generated by transpositions not involving the fixed element.  (Contributed by AV, 17-Jan-2019.)
statement:
psgnfix.p $e |- P = ( Base ` ( SymGrp ` N ) ) $.
psgnfix.t $e |- T = ran ( pmTrsp ` ( N \ { K } ) ) $.
psgnfix.s $e |- S = ( SymGrp ` ( N \ { K } ) ) $.
psgnfix.z $e |- Z = ( SymGrp ` N ) $.
psgnfix.r $e |- R = ran ( pmTrsp ` N ) $.
psgnfix2 $p |- ( ( N e. Fin /\ K e. N ) -> ( Q e. { q e. P | ( q ` K ) = K } -> E. w e. Word R Q = ( Z gsum w ) ) ) $.
$d K q $.
$d K w $.
$d N w $.
$d P q $.
$d Q q $.
$d Q w $.
$d R w $.
$d S w $.
$d T w $.
$d Z w $.
